headline.main: Quest for Lean Meat Prompts New Approach

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: SCIENTISTS say the nation is on the verge of a new agricultural revolution, a radical approach to livestock production involving the manipulation of the animals' own hormones to produce cheaper and more nutritious meat and dairy products. If the new methods are widely adopted, as farm experts say they must be for reasons of health and economics, they will yield animal products that are richer in proteins but lower in fats and calories.
